Appconfig

Email settings

Set up all outgoing email from this Hoodie app. Find out more in the plugin docs.
App name
Default "from" E-mail address

The "from"-address is used for password reset emails, for example.

CSS Test Page

A label

Example block-level help text goes in a paragraph with class "help-block".

This input is type="email" and required, so it's marked with an exclamation mark over there on the right. Once you enter a valid email, that exclamation mark will be replaced by a green check mark. This is how all HTML5 form validation features (required, patterns and types) are handled in Admin Dashboard.

This input has the class "invalid", you can use this for server-side validation.

You can also get the green checkmark by manually adding the class "valid" to an input.

Admin Dashboard uses Dropzone.js for file uploads. Please consult the docs there for more information on options, such as maxFilesize, maxFiles, accepted file types etc. There is an example dropzone implementation in hoodie-admin-dashboard-UIKit's main.js (with your Hoodie app running, it's at /_api/_plugins/_assets/scripts/main.js)

Tables

Tables are tables. Give them the class `table-striped` to make them zebraesque. There's a small helper for showing the status of a row: any `tr` with class `status` plus any of the following classes will show one of those nice status indicators you see over there on the right.

  • Green dot: `on`, `yes` or `true`
  • Red dot: `off`, `no or `false`
  • Yellow dot: `warn`

Additionally, you can use `status` and its modifier classes in individual `spans` as well. For example:this works,this has a problem andthis one has probably had it.

Username Signup date Status
Username Signup date Status
Hans Hansen June 14, 16:03 Confirmed edit / delete
Jan Jansen June 10, 11:56 Unconfirmed edit / delete
Snip Kibbles June 10, 11:57 Confirmed edit / delete
Horst von Horstingen June 14, 16:03 Error edit / delete
Wip Hamson June 10, 11:56 Confirmed edit / delete
Fub Melwyn June 10, 11:57 Confirmed edit / delete
Tables cont.

You can add `pill` along with the usual `success`, `warn` and `error` class to any `span` or `a`. These currently only work in tables. This is a link
